WorldDesc: A broken emblem made in ancient style. Can slightly increase Signal Orb Production Efficiency.

Description: Recovery speed of Signal Orbs by Basic Attack <color=#dbb536>+50%</color>.

Description: Recovery speed of Signal Orbs by Basic Attack <color=#dbb536>+100%</color>.

Name: Replica: Glyph of Advantage Lv.1
Description: Gains <color=#dbb536>1</color> additional set of 3-Ping Orbs at the beginning of the battle.
WorldDesc: A broken emblem made in ancient style. Can grant 1 set of 3-Ping Signal Orbs at the beginning of the battle.

Name: Replica: Glyph of Advantage Lv.2
Description: Gains <color=#dbb536>2</color> additional sets of 3-Ping Orbs at the beginning of the battle.
WorldDesc: A small emblem made in ancient style. Can grant 2 sets of 3-Ping Signal Orbs at the beginning of the battle.

Name: Replica: Glyph of Advantage Lv.3
Description: Gains <color=#dbb536>3</color> additional sets of 3-Ping Orbs at the beginning of the battle.
WorldDesc: A big emblem made in ancient style. Can grant 3 sets of 3-Ping Signal Orbs at the beginning of the battle.

Name: Replica: Glyph of Aftershocks Lv.2
Description: Obtains <color=#dbb536>2 sets</color> of 3-Ping Orbs upon casting a Signature Move.
WorldDesc: A small emblem made in ancient style. Can grant 2 sets of 3-Ping Signal Orbs upon casting a Signature Move.

Name: Replica: Glyph of Aftershocks Lv.3
Description: Obtains <color=#dbb536>3 sets</color> of 3-Ping Orbs upon casting a Signature Move.
WorldDesc: A big emblem made in ancient style. Can grant 3 sets of 3-Ping Signal Orbs upon casting a Signature Move.

Name: Loose-Packed Tinbread Cookies
WorldDesc: A few Tinbread Cookies.

Name: Small Tinbread Cookie Bag
WorldDesc: A small bag of Tinbread Cookies.

Name: Large Tinbread Cookie Bag
WorldDesc: A large bag of Tinbread Cookies.

Name: Replica: Glyph of Gluttony Lv.1
Description: Battle victory grants <color=#dbb536>2</color> extra Tinbread Cookies.
WorldDesc: A broken emblem made in ancient style. Can slightly increase the Tinbread Cookies obtained in battle.

Name: Replica: Glyph of Gluttony Lv.2
Description: Battle victory grants <color=#dbb536>4</color> extra Tinbread Cookies.
WorldDesc: A small emblem made in ancient style. Can mildly increase the Tinbread Cookies obtained in battle.

Name: Replica: Glyph of Gluttony Lv.3
Description: Battle victory grants <color=#dbb536>6</color> extra Tinbread Cookies.
WorldDesc: A big emblem made in ancient style. Can significantly increase the Tinbread Cookies obtained in battle.

Name: Replica: Glyph of Grace Lv.2
Description: Each node cleared grants <color=#dbb536>2</color> extra Tinbread Cookies.
WorldDesc: A small emblem made in ancient style. Can mildly increase the Tinbread Cookies obtained after clearing a node.

Name: Replica: Glyph of Grace Lv.3
Description: Each node cleared grants <color=#dbb536>3</color> extra Tinbread Cookies.
WorldDesc: A big emblem made in ancient style. Can significantly increase the Tinbread Cookies obtained after clearing a node.

Name: Small Biomimetic Blood
Description: Gives <color=#dbb536>3</color> bottles of Biomimetic Blood directly (For team resurrection/stage restart).
WorldDesc: A small bottle of Biomimetic Blood.

Name: Medium Biomimetic Blood
Description: Gives <color=#dbb536>6</color> bottles of Biomimetic Blood directly (For team resurrection/stage restart).
WorldDesc: A medium bottle of Biomimetic Blood.

Name: Large Biomimetic Blood
Description: Gives <color=#dbb536>9</color> bottles of Biomimetic Blood directly (For team resurrection/stage restart).
WorldDesc: A big bottle of Biomimetic Blood.

Name: Special Biomimetic Blood
Description: Gives <color=#dbb536>12</color> bottles of Biomimetic Blood directly (For team resurrection/stage restart).
WorldDesc: Biomimetic Blood made in a special method.

Name: Glyph of Survival
Description: Each node cleared grants <color=#dbb536>1</color> extra bottle of Biomimetic Blood (For team resurrection/stage restart).
WorldDesc: A broken emblem made in ancient style. Can slightly increase the Biomimetic Blood obtained after clearing a node.

Name: Glyph of Recruitment
WorldDesc: A proof of friendship with the outlier. Use it to gain bonus Recruitment Voucher Refresh Attempts.

Name: Glyph of Greed
WorldDesc: A proof of friendship with merchants. Use it to gain more discount slots in the shop.

Name: Glyph of Resonance
Description: Upon triggering a QTE, triggers the QTE of another character. Cooldown: <color=#dbb536>5</color>s.
WorldDesc: A special ancient emblem that possesses some kind of special power.

Name: Glyph of Swordsaint
WorldDesc: A special ancient emblem that possesses some kind of special power.

Name: Glyph of Broken Blade
Description: Basic Attack Extra DMG Bonus <color=#d84740>-50%</color>. Gains one Signal Orb every <color=#dbb536>2</color>s.
WorldDesc: A special ancient emblem that possesses some kind of special power.

Name: Glyph of Bind
Description: Dodges <color=#d84740>consume double Dodge Gauge</color>. Gains one Signal Orb every <color=#dbb536>2</color>s.
WorldDesc: A special ancient emblem that possesses some kind of special power.

Name: Glyph of Severance
Description: Extra DMG Bonus <color=#dbb536>+80%</color>. Each existing Signal Orb reduces the bonus effect by <color=#d84740>5%</color>.
WorldDesc: A special ancient emblem that possesses some kind of special power.

Name: Glyph of Onslaught
Description: Each existing Signal Orb increases the Extra DMG Bonus by <color=#dbb536>5%</color>.
WorldDesc: A special ancient emblem that possesses some kind of special power.

Name: Glyph of Power Surge
Description: Restores Signature Energy equal to <color=#dbb536>1%</color> of the Energy (which is not full).
WorldDesc: A special ancient emblem that possesses some kind of special power.

Name: Glyph of Shield
WorldDesc: A special ancient emblem that possesses some kind of special power.

Name: Glyph of Brawl
Description: Every <color=#dbb536>5</color>s, gains <color=#dbb536>5%</color> Extra DMG Bonus and loses <color=#d84740>5%</color> Extra DMG Reduction, up to <color=#dbb536>100%</color>.
WorldDesc: A special ancient emblem that possesses some kind of special power.

Name: Glyph of Abundance
Description: Each 3-Ping grants <color=#dbb536>1</color> orb of the same color.
WorldDesc: A special ancient emblem that possesses some kind of special power.

Name: Glyph of Horizon
Description: Upon casting a Signature, triggers an extra Matrix.
WorldDesc: A special ancient emblem that possesses some kind of special power.

Name: Glyph of Charge
Description: Upon casting a Signature, restores <color=#dbb536>50%</color> of the Signature Energy consumed.
WorldDesc: A special ancient emblem that possesses some kind of special power.

Name: Replica: Glyph of Charge Lv.2
WorldDesc: A special ancient emblem that possesses some kind of special power.

Name: Replica: Glyph of Charge Lv.3
WorldDesc: A special ancient emblem that possesses some kind of special power.

Name: Glyph of Instakill
Description: Upon switching to a new character, deals DMG equal to <color=#dbb536>500%</color> of the new character's ATK to all enemies within <color=#dbb536>6</color>m.
WorldDesc: A special ancient emblem that possesses some kind of special power.

Name: Glyph of Leadership
Description: All Recruitment Vouchers' Bonus Recruitment Attempts <color=#dbb536>+1</color>.
WorldDesc: A special ancient emblem that possesses some kind of special power.

Name: Glyph of Treasure
Description: All Item Boxes have a bigger chance to give a Rare/Legendary item.
WorldDesc: A special ancient emblem that possesses some kind of special power.

Name: Glyph of Source
Description: Each Artifact grants <color=#dbb536>+10%</color> Extra DMG Bonus.
WorldDesc: A special ancient emblem that possesses some kind of special power.

Name: The Returner's Blade
Description: It doesn't seem to have any special effects...
WorldDesc: A blade dropped after defeating the Ocean Guardian. It was crafted by artisans of ancient times and passed a long time. It's likely to be useful on some important occasion...

Name: The Brand of Void
WorldDesc: A mark that does not belong to the world, carrying the will that seems to have come from another world.

Name: The Brand of Infinity
WorldDesc: A mark that does not belong to the world, carrying the will that seems to have come from another world.

Name: Merlin's Jewel
Description: Recovers <color=#dbb536>5%</color> of max HP per second.
WorldDesc: A gem that gives off a dim blue light. Crafted with an ancient technique that was long lost, this gem named "Merlin" is a treasure that has been passed on through generations in a family.

Name: Indigo Wave Amethyst
Description: CRIT Rate and CRIT DMG increase by <color=#dbb536>+40%</color> and <color=#dbb536>+100%</color> respectively.
WorldDesc: A gem that gives off a dim indigo light and was crafted with an ancient technique that was long lost. When you put it next to your ear, you could hear the faint sound of waves coming from the gem.

Name: Broken Indigo Wave Amethyst
WorldDesc: A gem shard obtained by violently disassembling a mechanism. There is still some power left in it.

Name: Clyphas Black Codex
Description: Restores <color=#dbb536>3</color> Energy every second. Takes DMG equal to <color=#d84740>5%</color> max HP every second. And gains a <color=#dbb536>30%</color> Signature Extra DMG Bonus.
WorldDesc: A black codex with knowledge of ancient taboos. Although it might contain some wisdom, it's better to be buried in the distant past.

Name: Saphorus White Codex
Description: Restores <color=#dbb536>3</color> Energy every second. Restores <color=#dbb536>2%</color> max HP every second. And gains a <color=#dbb536>30%</color> Signature Extra DMG Bonus.
WorldDesc: A white codex with ancient knowledge. The first disciples should have been the ones who were closest to the ancient wisdom, but unfortunately, even their knowledge was lost in the long process of history.

Name: Red Teardrop Pendant
WorldDesc: A pendant with a red teardrop gem from a famous collector. Many are attracted by the various treasures lying deep under the sea and would even risk their lives to get them.

Name: Blue Teardrop Pendant
WorldDesc: A pendant with a blue teardrop gem from a famous collector. Many are attracted by the various treasures lying deep under the sea and would even risk their lives to get them.

Name: Yellow Teardrop Pendant
WorldDesc: A pendant with a yellow teardrop gem from a famous collector. Many are attracted by the various treasures lying deep under the sea and would even risk their lives to get them.

Name: Unstudied Antique Book
Description: Gains <color=#dbb536>6</color> random Signal Orbs at the beginning of the battle.
WorldDesc: The antique book that has been passed on through generations in an ancient school, whose founder seems to be the heir of a mythological hero. The knowledge passed on through a single bloodline failed to bring happiness to the world and eventually met its end.

Name: Scholar's Notes
Description: Gains <color=#dbb536>3</color> random Signal Orbs at the beginning of the battle.
WorldDesc: The notes left by a young scholar. It records what he saw and heard while traveling the world. Although he was not talented enough, he wished to make up for it by hard work.

Name: Note of the Ludicrous
Description: Gains <color=#dbb536>3</color> random sets of 3-Ping Orbs at the beginning of the battle.
WorldDesc: A note left by a certain ludicrous man who was still writing before until the last minute of his life. Pursuing something out of reach will eventually lead to madness.

Name: Sword of the Nameless
Description: Extra DMG Bonus <color=#dbb536>+50%</color>. Recovery speed of Signal Orbs by Basic Attack <color=#dbb536>-50%</color>.
WorldDesc: A sword left by someone unknown. Crafted with the lost forging technology, it is still as sharp as a new blade even after numerous battles.

Name: Black Nat
WorldDesc: A battle bot made by imitating the lost mechanical technology. It could play a important role on the battlefield.

Name: Auto Cannon Omega
WorldDesc: An auto cannon made with modern mechanical technology. It can offer fire support.

Name: Vista
Description: Characters' ATK increases by <color=#dbb536>7%</color> ATK every <color=#dbb536>10</color>s when they are on the field. Stacks up to <color=#dbb536>3</color> times.
WorldDesc: A well crafted scepter that seems to be a replica of the weapon wielded by a hero from the Mythical Age.

Name: Sun Bird
Description: When switched in, characters' ATK increases by <color=#dbb536>+7%</color> for <color=#dbb536>10</color>s. Stacks up to 3 times.
WorldDesc: A worn-out banner spear that seems to be a replica of the weapon wielded by a hero from the Mythical Age.

Name: The Defector's Family Crest
WorldDesc: A family crest owned by a defector who ran away at some point. The defector will eventually return to the sea and be buried deep under it.

Name: Heavy Blade of the Executioner
WorldDesc: The heavy blade dropped after defeating the mechanoid left by an ancient civilization. It is not a weapon that anyone can wield. In the war of the Mythical Age, mechanoids were the main force on the battlefield.

Name: Retail Biomimetic Blood (S)
Description: Gives <color=#dbb536>3</color> bottles of Biomimetic Blood directly (For team resurrection/stage restart).
WorldDesc: A small bottle of Biomimetic Blood. It's a Shark-speare Sale exclusive retail version and can be obtained repeatedly.

Name: Retail Biomimetic Blood (M)
Description: Gives <color=#dbb536>6</color> bottles of Biomimetic Blood directly (For team resurrection/stage restart).
WorldDesc: A medium bottle of Biomimetic Blood. It's a Shark-speare Sale exclusive retail version and can be obtained repeatedly.

Name: Retail Biomimetic Blood (L)
Description: Gives <color=#dbb536>9</color> bottles of Biomimetic Blood directly (For team resurrection/stage restart).
WorldDesc: A large bottle of Biomimetic Blood. It's a Shark-speare Sale exclusive retail version and can be obtained repeatedly.

Name: Star Core
Description: Gains <color=#dbb536>3 sets</color> of 3-Ping Orbs at the beginning of the battle.
WorldDesc: The shard of a meteorite that fell from the fake night sky. During the Mythical Age, unsung heroes used to be drifting under the starry night, exploring the unknown possibilities in the lonely universe.

Name: Elixir of Knowledge
WorldDesc: A forbidden elixir that deepens your connection with the world upon consumption.

Name: Book of Answers
WorldDesc: A forbidden antique book that deepens your connection with the world upon reading.

Name: Figurine of Transcendence
WorldDesc: A forbidden figurine that deepens your connection with the world upon possession.

Name: Mark of Pride
Description: Switch cooldown <color=#dbb536>-50%</color>, All DMG Bonus <color=#dbb536>+30%</color> for <color=#dbb536>10</color>s after switching; <color=#d84740>deployment positions -1</color>.
WorldDesc: An evil emblem of unknown origin, granting you power at the cost of your sanity.

Name: Mark of Sloth
Description: All DMG Bonus <color=#dbb536>+100%</color>; gains 1 orb per second and recovers <color=#dbb536>5%</color> HP. <color=#d84740>Cannot manually switch characters</color>.
WorldDesc: An evil emblem of unknown origin, granting you power at the cost of your sanity.

Name: Mark of Greed
Description: Grants an extra random collectible chest after every battle; <color=#d84740>no longer able to acquire Tinbread Cookies</color>.
WorldDesc: An evil emblem of unknown origin, granting you power at the cost of your sanity.

Name: Mark of Wrath
Description: Extra DMG Bonus <color=#dbb536>+60%</color>, max HP <color=#dbb536>+50%</color>; <color=#d84740>no longer able to acquire Biomimetic Blood</color>.
WorldDesc: An evil emblem of unknown origin, granting you power at the cost of your sanity.

Name: Mark of Gluttony
Description: Recruitment Vouchers' <color=#dbb536>recruitment attempts +1</color>; <color=#d84740>cannot refresh during recruitment</color>.
WorldDesc: An evil emblem of unknown origin, granting you power at the cost of your sanity.

Name: Blade of Frailty
Description: Extra DMG Bonus <color=#dbb536>+50%</color>; all <color=#d84740>enemies take +30% Extra DMG</color>.
WorldDesc: An evil emblem of unknown origin, granting you power at the cost of your sanity.

Name: Blood Transfusion
Description: Every <color=#dbb536>7</color>s, randomly gains <color=#dbb536>1 set</color> of 3-Ping orbs; loses <color=#d84740>3% of max HP per second</color>.
WorldDesc: An evil emblem of unknown origin, granting you power at the cost of your sanity.

Name: Power Shift
Description: Gains <color=#dbb536>3</color> Energy per second; <color=#d84740>Basic Attacks recover half as many Signal Orbs.</color>
WorldDesc: An evil emblem of unknown origin, granting you power at the cost of your sanity.

Name: Immovable Fortress
Description: Extra DMG Reduction <color=#dbb536>+50%</color>; Movement Speed and Dodge Recovery Speed <color=#d84740>-50%</color>.
WorldDesc: An evil emblem of unknown origin, granting you power at the cost of your sanity.

Name: Lone Wolf
Description: Extra DMG Bonus <color=#dbb536>+80%</color>; QTE and switch <color=#d84740>cooldown +50%</color>.
WorldDesc: An evil emblem of unknown origin, granting you power at the cost of your sanity.

Name: Fiery Red
Description: Basic Attack Extra DMG Bonus <color=#dbb536>+40%</color>; Orb Skill Extra DMG Bonus <color=#d84740>-20%</color>; collecting all three triples positive bonuses.
WorldDesc: An evil emblem of unknown origin, granting you power at the cost of your sanity.

Name: Serene Blue
Description: Orb Skill Extra DMG Bonus <color=#dbb536>+40%</color>; Signature Move Extra DMG Bonus <color=#d84740>-20%</color>; collecting all three triples positive bonuses.
WorldDesc: An evil emblem of unknown origin, granting you power at the cost of your sanity.

Name: Dark Shadow
Description: Signature Extra DMG Bonus <color=#dbb536>+40%</color>; Basic Attack Extra DMG Bonus <color=#d84740>-20%</color>; collecting all three triples positive bonuses.
WorldDesc: An evil emblem of unknown origin, granting you power at the cost of your sanity.

Name: Polarized First Strike
Description: Attacker and Vanguard DMG Bonus <color=#dbb536>+40%</color>; Tank DMG Bonus <color=#d84740>-20%</color>; collecting all three triples positive bonuses.
WorldDesc: An evil emblem of unknown origin, granting you power at the cost of your sanity.

Name: Polarized Shield
Description: Tank DMG Bonus <color=#dbb536>+40%</color>; Support and Amplifier DMG Bonus <color=#d84740>-20%</color>; collecting all three triples positive bonuses.
WorldDesc: An evil emblem of unknown origin, granting you power at the cost of your sanity.

Name: Polarized Backup
Description: Support and Amplifier DMG Bonus <color=#dbb536>+40%</color>; Attacker and Vanguard DMG Bonus <color=#d84740>-20%</color>; collecting all three triples positive bonuses.
WorldDesc: An evil emblem of unknown origin, granting you power at the cost of your sanity.

Name: Crimson Scroll Fragment
WorldDesc: Forbidden knowledge passed down through generations of the elusive Crimson Church. Now only fragments of it remain. Since its inception, the Crimson Church has been dedicated to studying Crimson creatures, believing they reveal the true nature of the world.

Name: Brand of Eternal Darkness
WorldDesc: A brand stamped by the Girl, carrying some form of wisdom.

Name: Tasty Milkshake
Description: Can be used to attract the <color=#d84740>legendary monster</color>.
WorldDesc: A beverage made using a secret recipe, rumored to attract a creature from myths.

Name: Proof of Friendship!
Description: All items in the Shark-speare Sale will be offered at a <color=#dbb536>100%</color> discount!
WorldDesc: Given after a battle with a certain legendary creature. As they say, you don't really know someone until you fight them. A fistfight is the most profound way to understand each other.

Name: Church Lance Ornament
WorldDesc: An ornament that once adorned the weapons of church knights. The church knights were the pioneers who explored the world after the cataclysm, and this lance ornament symbolizes the honors they once earned.

Name: Brand of Eternal Light
Description: You have become more <color=#d84740>determined to confront the Crimson</color>.
WorldDesc: Reforged by mankind, the Brand is shining with a certain willpower.
